body: @ser72 i can't reproduce it. any useful information in your owncloud.log or apache error log? does this problem only appears if the encryption app is enabled or also without the encryption app?

1) the issue only appears when encryption is enabled.  when encryption is disabled, you can revert to an old version without any issue

2) tested in the following browsers:
     a) internet explorer 9
     b) internet explorer 10
     c) google chrome

3) apache log doesn't show anything related to these activities

4) issue occurs whether i logged out and logged back in after enabling encryption or if i did not.
@karlitschek probably not, i still can't reproduce this issue

@ser72 did you also tested it with older owncloud versions? e.g. the current stable 5.0.10? does the issue also appears there or is this a new issue which only appears with the 5.0.11rc?

encryption and versioning are two complete independent apps, so i wonder why it should fail only if encryption is enabled. can you have a look at the file on your servers data directory after you tried to revert it. does the file exists? is the content of the file ok?

tested on stable 5.0.10 and this was not an issue.
tested on new install of 5.0.11 and can not reproduce anymore.
tried to test on same test bed i originally saw issue on and can not reproduce anymore.

i would say lets close this out and i will keep an eye on it and if i see it again, i will open a new github and look at the files in the data directory as you suggested.

> i would say lets close this out and i will keep an eye on it and if i see it again, i will open a new github and look at the files in the data directory as you suggested.

good plan, don't hesitate to open a new issue if you see it again.
